dialogue_tree.text: You see a caravan approach from ahead. You wave them down, hoping they might be able to assist you.
The caravan slows down, stopping just behind you. A man steps out, pointing a rifle at you.
"Give me any scrap metal you have", the man demands urgently.
All of your scrap metal is back with the caravan. There's only one option at your disposal.
You quickly raise your rifle and two shots ring out. You feel the bullet tear through your forearm with a sharp jolt of pain. The wound looks rough but managable.
But it seems your aim was truer. The man falls forward into the dirt with a heavy slam.

You examine your <color=#2675AD>rifle</color>, which appears to have cracked under the strain of the shot. After decades of wear and tear throughout the shattered colonies, weapons like these tend to be very fragile.
You barely have time to discard the <color=#2675AD>rifle</color> to your side before you hear commotion from the back of the caravan and several scrappers who don't look very pleased with you.
You pick your pace up to a run and continue toward the town off in the distance.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Smithsville sheriff should say this

dialogue_tree.text: Welcome to Smithsville! Our <color=#2675AD>generator</color> is out and we can't repair it. We've got a spare vehicle but no one can leave town long enough to get to York and buy a new one. Can you help us out?
Great! Take this medicine and fuel and trade for a new <color=#2675AD>generator</color> in York.
I'll let the gatekeeper know to let you through so you can start travelling eastward.
Feel free to visit our local hospital if you need a little assistance. That bullet wound of yours looks like it could use some tending to.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Smithsville Sheriff says this after (1)

dialogue_tree.text: Do you have that new <color=#2675AD>generator</color>?

buttons.text: [Give generator] Yep! Perfect condition too, hope it helps.

dialogue_tree.text: Thanks! Smithsville should be up and running again. Without that generator, the northern bridges would be unusable and we'd be cut off from the rest of the towns. Tell you what, keep the vehicle, and take some extra fuel. Least we can do to thank you.
Shame, Please bring a <color=#2675AD>generator</color> soon.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: need a way to specify automatic resolve conditions

dialogue_tree.text: You have arrived in York.
Exchange the medicine for a new <color=#2675AD>generator</color> at the local store.
Thanks for buying that generator!
Return to the sheriff in Smithsville.
A lone gas station on the side of the road. The pump is broken.
The owner sees you and says "I could repair that, but I don't have enough supplies".
"Come back later and I'll have this fixed!"
A lone gas station on the side of the road. The owner calls to you: "Hey Friend! Good price on fuel, just for you!"
"Thanks! Want to buy some more?"
You leave.
A lone gas station on the side of the road. The owner is offering fuel at various prices.
"Want to buy some more?"
A group of rough looking people stop your caravan. "This here's our road. Gotta pay to use it."
You pay the toll and leave.
"Can't pay, huh? Heh, go right ahead..."
"Sorry, guy. Go right ahead."
As you drive away, you hear a loud thunk. The bandits have damaged your vehicle!
You notice an old metal road sign. Someone has painted over it. It says "Warning: Bandit Territory!"
A landslide has blocked the road ahead.

buttons.text: Clear the way with your RPG.

dialogue_tree.text: You blast away the rock, clearing a path!
Where once the road was blocked, only rubble on the side of the road remains.
The town leader isn't available right now.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Called from the Hospital button in towns

dialogue_tree.text: Welcome to the Hospital.
You healed.
You left.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Smithsville

dialogue_tree.text: Thanks for getting us that generator!

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Smithsville?

dialogue_tree.text: Smithsville's seen better days. Coastal collapse is leading more folks to move inland every day.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for York

dialogue_tree.text: Welcome to York, traveller.

buttons.text: Can you tell me about York?

dialogue_tree.text: We deal with all manner of goods. We have a medicine shortage at the moment.
Not many people make the trek out this far to visit. Not that I mind the peace and quiet.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Frakton

dialogue_tree.text: Greetings, merchant. How can I help you?

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Frakton?

dialogue_tree.text: A city this size is always in need of food. We've got a small group of residents who value luxuries.
Frakton's been here since before the breaking. 'Course, it was a lot smaller back then.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Alabaster

dialogue_tree.text: Welcome to Alabaster. Are you here for medical aid?

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Alabaster?

dialogue_tree.text: Our patients are always in need of medical supplies and food.
Alabaster was built around the old world Alabaster Medical Center. In those days, the center was used to handle a pandemic.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for New Ottawa

dialogue_tree.text: Welcome to New Ottawa. Always great to see a caravan drive in!

buttons.text: Can you tell me about New Ottawa?

dialogue_tree.text: New Ottawa has the largest factory in Laurentia. We can always use raw materials. We'll pay extra for steel.
New Ottawa was built by refugees from the old Canadian capital. We're not quite sure how far away that was.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Rocket City

dialogue_tree.text: Greetings. We don't get many travellers out here.

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Rocket City?

dialogue_tree.text: We don't get much food out here. Anything you bring will be highly valued.
Every day, I pass by the old spaceship hangers and hope. If only we could get it working...

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Steelton

dialogue_tree.text: [Your request for a meeting with a representative of the Coalition was denied. Your inquiries are directed to an automated system.]

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Steelton?

dialogue_tree.text: Answer: Steelton needs iron ore.
Answer: Steelton was built around an old steel mill. As the only mill on the fragment, it remains highly important.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Lombard

dialogue_tree.text: Greetings, merchant. The pleasure is mine.

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Lombard?

dialogue_tree.text: Anything you can give to help our goal of Old World preservation would be appreciated.
Lombard is the oldest settlement on this fragment. Our museum holds artifacts from thousands of years ago. A history rapidly being forgotten, I'm afraid.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Skull

dialogue_tree.text:
[You are led to a lounge. Though you and Alex are the only ones here, you feel as if you are being watched.]
What do you want?

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Skull?

dialogue_tree.text: Food, materials, parts. All things we can't get with the big cities sanctioning us.
No.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Fields

dialogue_tree.text: Welcome to Fields!

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Fields?

dialogue_tree.text: We're a simple farming town. We sell food to the big cities, and in turn they sell us materials and parts.
There's nothing much to say, I'm afraid. We're just a group of people trying to get by.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Carrot Farm

dialogue_tree.text:
[A representative of the enigmatic Green Pact approaches]

...

buttons.text: ...can you tell me about Carrot Farm?

dialogue_tree.text: Machines. Tools. Materials. Parts.
No. We do not have carrots. What is a carrot?

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Sherbrooke

dialogue_tree.text: Hello there. Welcome to Sherbrooke.

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Sherbrooke?

dialogue_tree.text: We can always use materials, tools and parts for our farming equipment.
Sherbrooke's one of many farming communities that's sprung up to feed the people of Frakton.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Riverbed

dialogue_tree.text: Welcome to Riverbed.

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Riverbed?

dialogue_tree.text: We produce food, and we'll trade for materials, machinery and parts.
'Course, the river's all dried up. Ain't nobody seen a river since the old days.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Bordevide

dialogue_tree.text: Greetings. What brings you to Bordevide?

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Bordevide?

dialogue_tree.text: There's always a demand for parts and building materials around here.
Why settle so close to the edge? I don't know. When you stand close, watching the other fragments float by... it's almost like there's no gap at all.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Respite

dialogue_tree.text: Take a seat, traveller. Catch your breath. You're in Respite.

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Respite?

dialogue_tree.text: Folks are always needing tools and materials. Scrap, nails, motor parts, that kind of stuff.
The calm breeze, the gentle climate... You won't find anywhere nicer.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Farm-By-The-Island

dialogue_tree.text: Welcome to our small town. Here to see the sights?

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Farm-By-The-Island?

dialogue_tree.text: We'll buy any machinery, parts or materials you might have.
Isn't it beautiful? The large island floating by? So close you could almost jump. I wonder if I'll ever get to stand on it.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Green Greens

dialogue_tree.text: Kevin: Always a pleasure to see a visitor in our town. How can we help?

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Green Greens?

dialogue_tree.text: Do-yun: We'll buy materials and parts at a good price.
Kevin: You may think it strange that two people share the mayorship, but Do-yun's logistical skills and my farming experience are both invaluable.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Dustbowl

dialogue_tree.text: Hello, merchant. You are welcomed here.

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Dustbowl?

dialogue_tree.text: Despite our name, we are a farming community. We'll buy any parts or materials you have.
The settlers must have had a sense of humour. The soil here's as good as you'll find this side of Alabaster.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Jeb's Town

dialogue_tree.text: Please, Jebediah was my father. Call me Jeb.

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Jeb's Town?

dialogue_tree.text: Farms need parts and materials to keep running. And we all need farms to keep running, ha!
This town was founded by my grandfather. Can you guess his name?

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Lanark Mine

dialogue_tree.text: I'm afraid I'm quite busy, so this will have to be quick.

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Lanark Mine?

dialogue_tree.text: We'll buy anything we need to keep the mine running. Be it food, machinery, or parts, we'll take it.
Lanark's been operating for nigh on 50 years, and it's got a good few decades left in it. Hopefully...

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Irony

dialogue_tree.text: Hello there, merchant! Here to pick up?

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Irony?

dialogue_tree.text: We need machinery, parts, food, medicine. Any general good, we could use.
Well, it's like rain on your wedding day.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Fin

dialogue_tree.text: Wait you actually made it to the end? And you're still alive? That doesn't seem right.

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Fin?

dialogue_tree.text: Nothing. Or anything, I guess. You've won!
Sure. Fin is what happpens when you hit the Escape key.
The locals give you puzzled stares as you dig at the soil on the outskirts of town. Ignoring them, you keep digging until you reach the right depth.
You grab a bit of soil and insert it into your tricorder's sample tray. The screen lights up with data on mineral composition and moisture levels.
You remember that you lost your tricorder. Having dug a hole for nothing, you quickly run away from the gaze of the locals.
You arrive at the given coordinates.
You hold your tricorder in the air and collect data on chemical composition, atmospheric pressure and wind currents.
[As you browse the town's bulletin board, you notice somebody is looking to hire a merchant caravan.]
Hello! Thanks for coming to help. I'm from Steelton, not too far east of here. We make all the steel around these parts.
I came here to buy a replacement for a machine which broke down in our steel factory. I brought a lot of steel to trade for it, but I lost my cargo on the way here.
Landslide. Cliff came down on top of me. Not too uncommon nowadays. I was lucky to get out alive.
If you buy the replacement <color=#d9ae21>machinery</color> and bring it to Steelton, I'll reward you. Will you help me?
Very well. I will have to find someone else.
Thank you. Take this scrap - it was all I could salvage from the wreckage. It should help you buy the <color=#d9ae21>machinery</color>. Do you have any questions?

buttons.text: How can I afford the machinery?
How can I get to Steelton?

dialogue_tree.text: What do you need?

buttons.text: How can I afford the machinery?
How can I get to Steelton?

dialogue_tree.text: I wish I could give you more to trade. You'll have to find out what the store values and gather a lot of it.
Steelton is a medium town to the east of here. You'll find it just off the main road to Alabaster.
It's a large engine for carrying buckets of molten steel. Which, as you can imagine, is quite a weight to lift.
Alright. I'll be waiting for you in Steelton.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Appears in Steelton after 2

dialogue_tree.text: Do you have that new <color=#d9ae21>machinery</color>?

buttons.text: [Give machinery] Yes, I have it here.

dialogue_tree.text: You're a life-saver. We'll pay you in steel, of course.
Alright. It's not vital... yet. Please bring the new <color=#d9ae21>machinery</color> soon.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Science Quest Part 1

dialogue_tree.text: Hello there. Can I help you?
My name is Penelope. I am a researcher from the Laurentian Institute.

buttons.text: What are you doing out here?

dialogue_tree.text: My fellow researchers and I are studying the fragment. We believe we're on the verge of a great discovery.
That doesn't concern you... Unless you'd like to help us?
You are a travelling merchant, are you not? You can help us by gathering data along your travels.
You don't have to be. Here, take this tricorder. You can use it to take measurements.

buttons.text: What kind of measurements do you need?

dialogue_tree.text: We need data on seismic activity and soil composition.

buttons.text: How can I get seismic data?
Where can I take soil samples?
What do I do with the data?

dialogue_tree.text: I'm sure you've noticed how common earthquakes are. Next time one happens, take some measurements.
We don't want all our soil samples to be from the same place. If you travel to towns around the continent, you can get a good variety of data.
My colleagues are all over the place. If you find one, you can give your data to them.
Anything else?

buttons.text: How can I get seismic data?
Where can I take soil samples?
What do I do with the data?

dialogue_tree.text: Great! Thanks for helping us.
Alright. Goodbye.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Science Quest Part 2A

dialogue_tree.text: Hello there. Can I help you?

buttons.text: I have some data to hand in.

dialogue_tree.text: Great! What do you have for us?
Anything else?
Hmm... these stress patterns... Notice how the P and S waves propogate. This suggests... no, that can't be.
This sample is less healthy than our previous samples. The soil is drier, with fewer essential chemicals. That doesn't bode well for the farmers.
Thanks for your help, trader.
How can I help?

buttons.text: How can I get seismic data?
Where can I take soil samples?

dialogue_tree.text: Use your tricorder during an earthquake to measure its strength. They happen all the time.
Visit towns across the fragment. If you sample soil at different towns, we'll have a large variety of samples.
We're hoping to learn more about the nature of these fragments and what caused the Shattering.
Alright, be seeing you!

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Lombard

dialogue_tree.text: Greetings, merchant. The pleasure is mine.

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Lombard?
Do you know anything about old spacecraft?

dialogue_tree.text: Anything you can give to help our goal of Old World preservation would be appreciated.
Lombard is the oldest settlement on this fragment. Our museum holds artifacts from thousands of years ago. A history rapidly being forgotten, I'm afraid.
Spaceflight? Gemini, Vostok, Apollo, Soyuz, Artemis? A passion of mine. How can I help?
I... see. I believe you. I have many friends at the Laurentian Institute. Here, take this.
These are blueprints from the old Artemis program. Bring them to the factory in New Ottawa. They should be able to build this.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for New Ottawa

dialogue_tree.text: Welcome to New Ottawa. Always great to see a caravan drive in!

buttons.text: Can you tell me about New Ottawa?
Can you build this for me?

dialogue_tree.text: New Ottawa has the largest factory in Laurentia. We can always use raw materials. We'll pay extra for steel.
New Ottawa was built by refugees from the old Canadian capital. We're not quite sure how far away that was.
I've never seen anything like this. But don't worry, we can build anything! You'll need to bring us 15 steel

[Through the improbability of game logic, the factory workers build the engine instantly.]
What a job! I've never seen an engine this big! Hope you're satisfied!

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Rocket City

dialogue_tree.text: Greetings. The Institute told me to expect you.

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Rocket City?

dialogue_tree.text: We don't get much food out here. Anything you bring will be highly valued.
Every day, I pass by the old spaceship hangers. Our only hope is to get it fixed.
The Institute believes the fragment will collapse soon. They want us to rebuild the old spacecraft here so we can evacuate.
We need a new engine. Unfortunately, no one's known how to build one since the old Artemis program over 50 years ago.
We need to find records of the old space programs. Our best bet is to look where old world knowledge is found. Library ruins, old computers, something like that.
You'd be suprised. Pre-shattering artifacts are found all the time. Scavengers find books, storage devices, old electronics.

buttons.text: I'll see what I can find.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Rocket City

dialogue_tree.text: Greetings. I hope you bring good news.

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Rocket City?

dialogue_tree.text: We don't get much food out here. Anything you bring will be highly valued.
Every day, I pass by the old spaceship hangers. Our only hope is to get it fixed.
This... this is incredible! We can rebuild the spaceship with this! You've saved a lot of lives today, friend.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Rocket City

dialogue_tree.text: Thanks for helping us rebuild the rocket.

buttons.text: Can you tell me about Rocket City?

dialogue_tree.text: We don't get much food out here. Anything you bring will be highly valued.
Every day, I pass by the old spaceship hangers with pride. You've done a good thing.

fixed_encounters.NOTE: Said by the town leader for Rocket City

dialogue_tree.text: [You receive a call via radio].
Hello? It's Penelope, the researcher. We met in Fields, remember?
Thanks to the data you collected, we've been able to reach a... conclusion.
The earthquakes aren't just shaking the Earth. The entire fragment is being torn apart. That's why the soil's been getting worse every year.
We estimate that within 5 years, Laurentia will shatter again. All that will be left this time are dry chunks of rock.

buttons.text: Can we do anything about it?

dialogue_tree.text: We aren't sure. But we're preparing for the worse. Go to Rocket City. The Overseer there will fill you in on the details.
Yes. It might help us find a way to prevent the fragment collapse.
You and your crew settle in for the night and talk about the day's events and plan for your continued journey tomorrow.
After a long day it's always nice to laugh and share food with those you care about.
You curl up in your warm sleeping bag as the dreamy night air fills your lungs.
The quiet ambience of the crickets sooth your ears and gently lulls you off.
You come across a travelling merchant
Sure, but lets have a little fun. Make an offer and we'll flip a coin to pick between fuel or some spare wrenches.

buttons.text: [Sample] offer 5 rations for 10 fuel or 2 wrenches.
[Bulk] offer 15 rations for 40 fuel or 10 wrenches.

dialogue_tree.text: That seems mighty fair to me!
Well it's been nice talking to you.

You come across a strange device unlike anything you’ve seen before, you see what appears to be a button on the surface. Foolishly you reach inside and touch the button, triggering a trap and locking your hand inside

buttons.text: [press button] Lose all of a random resource in exchange for 5 of another resource

dialogue_tree.text: Panicked, you smash the device latched to your hand against the ground until you're released. You got some bad cuts in the process though.
An interface flashes to life as you touch the button to your surprise spits out a handful of resources.
Not one to look a gift horse in the mouth, you bring your spoils to the cargo bay. However you find another one of your resources has vanished without a trace.
You find an old alchemist's laboratory, in it a device with slots for two objects

buttons.text: [Transmute] Lose all of one random item, gain 50 Fuel
[Double or Nothing] Lose all of two random items, gain 100 fuel

dialogue_tree.text: Being the clutz you are, you knock the device off the table and are caught in a small explosion. Thankfully you have no life-threatening injuries, but you're definitely worse for wear.
The materials begin to glow brighter and brighter until nearly blinding. Once the light stops you find the device is nowhere to be found, but a fair amount of fuel is left in its place

As you're driving you hear a loud bang and you notice fuel beginning to leak from your vehicle. The damages are beyond you. Luckily an elderly mechanic crosses your path; "You look like you're in a spot of trouble eh? I can help ya out if you make it worth my while."

buttons.text: [Trade] Repair your vehicle for 20 Scrap Metal and 15 Fuel
[Threaten with Hunting Rifle] Repair your vehicle, take 20 damage
[Stubborn] Get out and push, Lose 25 Fuel

dialogue_tree.text: You know a price gouge when you see one. You'll get back to town on your own terms.
You pay the mechanic and they get to work, they were even nice enough to change your oil while they were at it.
Seeing an opportunity, you pull out your weapon and tell the mechanic to get to work, they oblige. After the work is complete you leave without a second thought.
You open the hood to inspect the work but trigger a small explosion. Pieces of shrapnel litter your arm; it seems the mechanic thought you deserving of a little surprise...
The ship shakes violently, interrupting your meal. You've found your way into an unmarked gravity well. The ship is too heavy for the engines to escape, you’ll need to ditch some cargo.

buttons.text: [Eject Resource] lose 100% of a random resource

dialogue_tree.text: Quickly, you slam open the cargo bays and watch as your precious goods fall into the void. Thankfully it was enough for you to escape. Not everyone is as lucky.

random_encounters.COMMENT: Would like it to only spawn if player is missing health

dialogue_tree.text: You come across an old medical bay. Surprisingly, there are still some supplies left.
Something feels off - why would these supplies be left untouched? The last thing you want is your crew getting sick from bad meds, so you leave.
You and your crew take turns tending to each others wounds, distributing antibiotics and pain killers as necessary.
You come across a sickly looking merchant. They show you a completely unmarked box, "Trade?"
You ignore them and are about to continue on your way when you hear them pull a gun, looks like they weren't asking.

buttons.text: [Fight] Use hunting rifle, 50% chance to lose 40 hp
[Grovel] Beg for your life, lose 25 hp

dialogue_tree.text: The stranger smiles and gives you the box before snatching the Medicine from your hands. You open the box to find some Jewelry! When you look up the merchant is gone.
The stranger snatches the Herbal Medicine from you and retreats.
You draw your gun and a fire fight ensues. When the dust settles only one of you is still standing, and it isn't the merchant.

The merchant snarls "Worthless! Pathetic!". A loud bang accompanies the stabbing pain that shoots through your thigh as you fall to the ground and feel the blood pour down leg. Thankfully they seem happy with their pound of flesh and retreat.

random_encounters.COMMENT: let player gamble for item types, would require a !has_type
hacked together since we lacked random_page, unfortunately deterministic

dialogue_tree.text: While travelling, you find what appears to be a carnival. Curious, you get out of your ship and investigate. Upon entering the tent you feel a heavy Whack against the back of your head. You wake up restrained and in darkness.

Nothing happens for awhile, then suddenly blinding spotlights flash to life revealing a cheering crowd, with armed guards and cameras everywhere. Next to you is a large game wheel. The restraints release and the crowd begins chanting ever louder “Spin! Spin! Spin!”

buttons.text: [Run] Make an example of yourself, drop to 1 hp

dialogue_tree.text: "What is bravery without a dash of recklessness" you ask yourself. You'd soon learn the answer. Before you can even make it 10 yards you're jabbed in the neck with a cattle prod and beaten unconscious by the guards. You're surprised when you somehow to wake up next to your ship, still barely alive.
The wheel lands on a symbol with no meaning to you, and before appears you a panel of four buttons with words you cannot decipher

The crowd cheers and you’re knocked out again. When you wake up you’re in your ship, immediately you feel pain and notice the heavy bandages around your chest. Still confused you take them off and find a large scar sealed with stitches. Alarmed but thankful to still be alive, you quickly continue on your way.

The crowd cheers and you’re knocked out again, when you wake up you’re in your ship, you notice quickly however all your wounds have been treated. Hell, even the tears in your clothes were mended. Unsure if you should be thankful or scared and head still pounding, you quickly fly your ship away.

The crowd cheers and you’re knocked out again, when you wake up you’re in your ship, nothing is missing or damaged, but there’s no sign of your first mate, your other crew are confused when you ask and insist that the person you're referring to has never existed. Unsure if you're losing it, head still pounding, you quickly fly your ship away.

The crowd cheers and you’re knocked out again, when you wake up you’re in your ship, to your shock there is a dishevelled stranger next to you. Terrified, they beg you to take them and the ship far away from this place, before the troupe decides to return. You could use the help and don't want to stay here any longer either.
While travelling you find some stones that look out of place, being curious you move them and find a cache of medical supplies!
Given how it was hidden, whoever left it here will probably come back for it. Hopefully they need it more than you do.
You don't even know if the person who left these is still alive, and you certainly have use for extra medicine. Having convinced yourself, you take the medical supplies.
You find an old military barracks while travelling, seemingly still stocked with some supplies.
You find some bullet proof vests. While you don't plan on getting into any gunfights any time soon, always better safe than sorry.
You and your crew take turns tending to each others wounds and distribute antibiotics and pain killers as necessary.
You find an RPG laying out in the open. Something tells you it’s too good to be true.

buttons.text: [Take] claim the RPG -- Trigger a trap

dialogue_tree.text: Something that valuable wouldn’t just be laying around, better not to risk it.
Greed gets the better of you and you grab the RPG - then something starts beeping. Your gut was right and the trap is sprung.
You react quickly and jump to cover, you and your crew sustained a number of injuries but thankfully nothing that can't be healed. You decide to leave before the person who set the trap returns.

By the time you realize what's happening, it's too late. The blast goes off and heavy shrapnel is lodged into your leg. You've seen amputations for less. Hurriedly, you wrap it to stop the bleeding and limp back to the ship before the person who set the trap returns.

In an act of selflessness, one of your crew jumps to action and throws themselves onto the bomb. You begin shouting for them to stop but your words are silenced by the blast... You’ll hold a service for them when you get to port.

You stumble accross a decaying research facility, isolated and desolate. As you wander from room to room, you come across two vials of translucent liquid. You find some files nearby documenting the effects

You gather that each vial contains a variant of nanobots. One will heal you at the cost of reducing your life expectancy, the other will temporarily cripple you but make your body behave as if you were a decade younger in the long term.
The nanobots quickly purge your body of trauma - you can't remember the last time you felt this good.
You double over in pain as the nanobots aggressively invade your body. Hopefully it'll pay off in the long run.

random_encounters.COMMENT: need more food than rations, something like 'sugar donut'

dialogue_tree.text: You pull up for a brief break at a rest stop, the sign for a nearby bakery catches your eye.
You had a big lunch, best not tempt yourself.
"I'll just take a look at what they have", you told yourself. The smells convince you otherwise when you enter. The shelves are a great deal more spacious after you leave.

random_encounters.COMMENT: could have a quest as an option to get help from their town, talk to town leader

dialogue_tree.text: You come across a group of stranded travellers, you don’t have enough room in your ship to transport them all. Not wanting to leave anyone behind they ask if you’ve any food or fuel to spare, they have a doctor who could heal your wounds in exchange.

buttons.text: [Malevolence] Threaten with Hunting Rifle, heal 20% hp, lose reputation.

dialogue_tree.text: You apologize saying you don’t have anything to spare. When they ask you to tell their sheriff what’s happened to them you say yes to avoid confrontation, but unfortunately for them you have neither the time nor desire to help these people.

Grateful that they can finally escape with the fuel you’ve given them, the doctor gets to work mending your wounds with what little supplies they had left. When they’re done you feel noticeably better. Happy with the exchange you both set out to continue your journeys.

While they would have preferred to be able to escape, they’re grateful that you’ve given them enough food to survive hopefully long enough for another vessel to find them. The doctor gets to work mending your wounds with what little supplies they had left. When they’re done you feel noticeably better and continue on your way.

You draw your gun and threaten take everything they have unless the doctor heals you. One of the men steps forward to challenge you but regrets it after you pull the trigger. The doctor agrees to heal you on the condition you don't shoot anyone else. When they’re done you feel noticeably better and continue on your way, though looking back you fear stories may spread if they survive somehow.

You spot a cluster of scrap in some turbulent looking space, feeling lucky you decide to go for it. Unfortunately you got more than you bargained for and now have to choose between taking some asteroid hits to get the loot or dropping some weight to escape.
You manage to get to the cluster and escape with only a few scrapes. Some of the crew begin to realize why their insurance premiums went up after joining you.
You get the feeling that being on a first name basis with the mechanic probably isn’t good for your pockets and decide to cut your losses.

random_encounters.COMMENT: IF UPDATING REMEMBER TO CHANGE BOTH

dialogue_tree.text: You come across a somewhat sketchy looking lab; so of course you decide to dock and see what you can find. The bay doors close behind you and you are greeted by an enigmatic figure who offers to grant various requests in exchange for "Samples"

buttons.text: [Sustenance] Gain 30 Rations or Fuel, lose 12% hp
[Greed] Gain a random Combat item, lose 12% hp

dialogue_tree.text: Well? What is it?

buttons.text: [Sustenance] Gain 30 Rations or Fuel, lose 12% hp
[Greed] Gain a random Combat item, lose 12% hp

dialogue_tree.text: They grab a clean syringe and draw a pint of blood before retrieving the agreed upon resources from their cloak. "Anything else?"
They grab a clean syringe and draw a pint of blood before retrieving the agreed upon Luxury from their cloak. "Anything else?"

They grab a clean syringe and draw a pint of blood and proceeds to carve an intricate sigil into your flesh. Alarmed at first, you're surprised when you feel no pain, and feel stronger when it's done. "Anything else?"

They raise an eyebrow as if the question is below them but harvest the payment from you anyway. "Big flashing button next to the landing bay doors over there. If you don’t mind I’ve work to get back to", before you can open your mouth they’ve already retreated back to the shadows. Best leave before they decide to harvest anything else.

random_encounters.COMMENT: ADD CREW REMOVE EFFECT TO ID 5

dialogue_tree.text: You’re approached by an elderly man draped in rags. He slowly brings out an unmarked box and pleads in a raspy voice, "I don’t have much, but it's yours if you could spare some food"

buttons.text: [Cruelty] <<WIP>> Steal the box, lose a crew member

dialogue_tree.text: You pass by as if you didn’t hear him but you both know you did. He meekly lowers the box and begins looking for someone willing to hear his plea.
"Th-Thank you" he stammers, "I'll not forget this kindess. That ring belonged to my partner; I'm too old for the trader's life, but it should be worth something".
You push the old man to the ground and steal the box. "N-No! Please! It’s all I have!" he shouts after you. But you’re already too far away for him to do anything.
You return to the ship and are confronted by one of your crew "I saw what you did to that old man. I quit, effective immediately.". Before you can try to defend your actions, they walk away.
You take pity on the man and return the ring. He breaks down and hugs you. You leave feeling you've done a good thing.
You wish the man luck and continue on your way.
"You there!", two men beckon you towards them. "We need someone to bear witness to our duel, to make it worth your time you can place a bet on who’ll win". Sounds like easy money.

buttons.text: [Safe Bet] 70% chance to win 3 Iron Ore
[Risky Bet] 30% chance to win 12 Iron Ore

dialogue_tree.text: The smoke clears and the victor laughs in triumph. "Thanks for your time, you don't know how long we've waited for someone willing to spectate!
There is a fork in the road, A sign advertises that one path has a painter offering free samples and the other has a chiropractor offering free adjustments.
"Welcome, welcome!" you're ushered in. The wall is covered in antique paintings, if not for the duplicates you wouldn't know they were forgeries.
As you leave the store with your sample the painter shouts after you "Don’t forget to tell your friends where you got that now, ya hear!"
"Oi! How ya doing, mate?", the physician welcomes you in. "Here for the free adjustments ya say? Well, come on in then no need to be shy!"
A number of uncomfortable cracks later you feel much better. "There ya go, good as new. Thanks for stopping by and don’t ya forget to spread the word, eh?" You thank them and hobble back to the ship.

Tired of your relatively uneventful journey thus far, you decided to take a shortcut through some more questionable territory. Considering the ambush you find yourself in now that may have been a mistake.

buttons.text: [Pay the toll] lose 100% of a random Luxury good
[Pay the toll] lose 100% of a random Combat resource
[Pay the toll] lose 100% of a random Medical resource
[Pay the toll] lose 100% of your Fuel

dialogue_tree.text: You meekly pay the toll for trespassing and leave with your life.
As you continue down the road you notice you’ve repeatedly passed the same dishevelled looking traveller. You stop to investigate and the stranger asks you to make a deal.

buttons.text: [Hasty Bargain] Gain 100% max hp, reduce your current hp to 1
[Panacea] Gain numerious Medical supplies, Lose 40% max hp
[Doppelganger] <<WIP>> Gain a crew member, Lose 33% max hp

dialogue_tree.text: The stranger grabs your hand and at first you feel a surge of vitality course through. "Pleasure doing business with you." the stranger chuckles.

Immediately, you fall to the ground and writhe in inconceivable anguish, it feels like fire surging through your veins while every nerve is stabbed with a thousand needles. The pain lasted only seconds but it felt like an eternity. Gasping for air as the pain recedes, you watch the stranger - appearing considerably younger - cackle as they walk away.

The stranger grabs your hand and you fall to the ground feeling like you've just been run through by a jagged blade, gasping through the pain you find no wound and a stack of medical supplies next to you. "Pleasure doing business with you." the stranger cackles, you can't tell for sure but somehow they appear considerably younger walking away.

The stranger grabs your hand and you fall to the ground feeling like you've just been run through by a jagged blade. The stranger's grip tightens, wheezing through the pain you watch in horror as their face melds and shifts until it is your own face looking back at you.

The pain disappears as stranger pulls you to your feet cackling, "Pleasure doing business with you, Captain". Afriad of what might happen if you try to go back on the deal, you bring them to your ship and continue on your way

dialogue_tree.text: A gleam in the dirt catches your eye - a metal object lies on the ground.
You find a strange metal symbol. It doesn't seem to be worth much, but perhaps it has another use.
After pushing your vehicle for hours you trip and hit your teeth against your rear bumper on the way down
You lay face down in the dirt for a few minutes before finding the motivation to get up and continue pushing.
After pushing your vehicle for hours you stop to take a small break when you hear a twig snap
you hear the bushes rustle and rise to your feet. You hear a low growl as 3 Coyotes begin to charge you from the darkness.

buttons.text: [Adrenaline] Fight them off with your fists, Gain 3 Fresh Meat, Lose 25 hp.
[Carnage] Fight them off with your Hunting Rifle, Gain 3 Fresh Meat, Lose 10 hp.
[Brutality] Fight them off with an RPG.

dialogue_tree.text: You smash the bottle you were drinking from and fight for your life. Once the dust settles you're covered in blood, not all of it yours. You harvest the meat from the corpses, might as well get a meal for your efforts.

You bolt for your gun and shoot the first two before they reach you, the third sinks its teeth into your exposed leg. Ignoring the pain you finish the fight. You harvest the meat from the corpses, might as well get a meal for your efforts.
You bolt for your RPG and fire. The blast singes off your eyebrows and splatters you with viscera. As if you didn't need a shower before, today is just not your day.

While pushing your vehicle you're knocked unconscious. You awaken with a throbbing head to find yourself in the middle of a large arena surrounded by a cheering audience. Before you have time to fully take in your situation the ringleader bellows "Let the battle begin!"

The gates open and your challenger approaches, From their weapons and the blood splattered around the arena it looks like only one of you will be surviving this match. Luckily for you they didn't remove any of your equipment.

buttons.text: [Reckless Charge] Fight with your bare hands, Lose 30 hp.
[Rip and Tear] Fight with your Hatchet, Lose 20 hp.
[Rupture] Fight with your Hunting Rifle, Lose 15 hp.
[Reaper] Fight with an RPG, is that even fair?

dialogue_tree.text: Your opponent falls and the crowd goes wild. "Seems you're tougher than you look!" the ringleader howls, "Time for a real challenge!". While he riles up the crowd, you notice a crack in the wall you might be able to escape through while everyone is distracted. Though, the champion of the arena is likely well rewarded.

buttons.text: [Berserker] A large fight with even larger rewards.

dialogue_tree.text: The gates open and your challenger approaches, They're far more intimidating than your last opponent but there's no backing out now.

buttons.text: [Outmaneuver] Fight with your bare hands, Lose 50% hp.
[Blade Dance] Fight with your Hatchet, Lose 35% hp.
[Predator] Fight with your Hunting Rifle, Lose 25% hp.
[Ragnarok] Fight with an RPG, lose 15% hp

dialogue_tree.text: Victory! Their champion lies broken at your feet and the crowd goes wild. Time to claim your spoils.

buttons.text: [Impervious] Gain 100 max hp and full heal.

dialogue_tree.text: You're given your rewards and returned to your ship. Your escort informs you the ringleader was impressed and "Looks forward to your next visit".
You're driving through an unremarkable plain when a you hear a faint rumbling, steadily getting louder. Soon, your entire vehicle is violently shaking.
Using your tricorder, you measure the seismic force and wave patterns.
Luckily, you always wear your seatbelt, and the earthquake passes without causing any damage.
For no apparent reason, you get the urge to stop and step outside. Something about this spot... you can feel it in your bones.
You dig at your feet and find an old artifact!
The feeling passes. It must have been nothing.
